text: Just arrived in Cambridge. Can feel my innate intelligence being debated already!
@Jason At least you're aware of it. :)
@Jason Don't you have a kid? There's no shame in acting like an adult.
@counternotions So why wouldn't a "your app has to be responsive" TOS cover it?
@counternotions I know that. Can you think of any reason app store guidelines shouldn't simply be about user experience instead of tools?
Every single one of the slowest, crashiest, ugliest apps for iPhone and iPad was made in Xcode. Guess it'll get banned next.
RT @owasow: #TooBlackForTwitter is a joke for blacks + a provocation to some whites: http://j.mp/cVyiEX http://j.mp/aEuMJO
@evgenymorozov What makes you dislike ChatRoulette?

@daiyami Seriously? Obvious tech minutiae vs. clear articulation of valuing education from greatest living philanthropist?
@djacobs woooohooo!
@jkottke Meh, just say it. Otherwise you're mostly just letting griefers edit your words. Tweet as honestly as you blog!

@jack We greet everyone that way!
@caro Seenit. http://dashes.com/anil/2010/01/free-publicity-who-do-we-help.html :P

Looking forward to meeting with the nice folks at @macfound today! (Going to see about getting @thegza a genius grant.)

@EstherPrade How can you say I'm not smart when I know all the words to "Why You Wanna Treat Me So Bad?" :)
Good news! Gizmodo <3 malaria, so you can show Gizmodo your contempt by texting NETS to 864233 for only $10. #endmalaria
@EstherPrade I'm not sure how to have a conversation with someone who's advocating in favor of prison rape.
@andrewruess I'm arguing prioritization. You think that should be the most important thing cops in San Mateo focus on?
@cleesiast But you don't object to corporations being able to do whatever they want?
@jterbeest I agree software piracy is not the same as stolen property. It's Apple's license agreements that argue that they're the same.
@jheftmann Arguing that Apple will encourage police to aggressively go after people who steal from them is not a slippery slope, it's fact.
@lucidbeing Oh please, I'm not justifying anything; I run a business too. But cops fighting for companies against citizens leads to bad shit
Can't wait for everyone to cheer the cops on as they invade the homes of everybody who pirated iLife.
@Lessien Smeared? Reporting something that actually happened is a smear? I am against cops kicking down doors in any non-violent situation.
@mat Yes, but Apple is a person. You're just a journalist.
Sorry, but I'm never rooting for the cops kicking down doors on behalf of multibillion dollar corporations.

@davewiner right, XML's totally set. I meant that W3C & IETF express new specs & formats in XML, not JSON - that's interesting.
@davewiner ah, I meant standards bodies express everything in XML, not JSON, so you avoid some potential conflicts by their inattention.
@davewiner The feature of JSON you'll like best is that there aren't any standards bodies or approval committees for using it.

Will someone ask Zuck why he doesn't use Facebook's default privacy at F8 tomorrow? If it's not good enough for him then why's it ok for us?

@miconian I think a mission statement can be a useful tool, but that doesn't mean they're 100% accurate as descriptors of organizations.
Not to say good institutions or leaders can't have clear goals, just that real life is complicated, and that's a good thing.
If you see a large company or institution described as a single-minded monolith with a clear, coherent goal, be suspicious.
@om @cdixon IM isn't "poorly monetized", it's just right for helping millions communicate. Think like humans, not VCs.
Guess it takes <48 hrs of my wife's absence to turn me into a sad caricature of an inept bachelor. Anyway, is eating moldy bread dangerous?
